body.p: “The tracks of the mice suggest extensive hopping in the night and going a-gadding. They commence and terminate in the most insignificant little holes by the side of a twig or tuft “,” and occasionally they give us the type of their tails very distinctly “,” even sidewise to the course on a bank-side “,” thus: -- [image]”
PE 10, pg. 157 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
